content: We were watching the news yesterday and they were talking about Staff Sgt. William Castillo, "http://buildinghomesforheroes.com/news/windermere.htm". Of course we had our eyes glued to the TV when it comes to any of our Vets. BUT, they showed a picture of his dog tags.... We have dish tv and we were able to pause the picture. We were able to read his tags, name, SS#, blood type and religion. Being very furious, I shot an email to fox news asking them if they were stupid or what, etc..... Haven't heard from them, but I am pretty sure we are not the only one to see this.

content: The SS thing happened just as I went in the service in the 70s. Some guys go both and ID number and SS. Then they decided just to go with the SS, because they figured everyone had one anyway, and it would streamline the process. Nobody back then suspected people would us SS#s to steal identities. We were told to put our SS#s on letters, and have parents/spouses/girl friends to do the same to get letters to us. We were requires to put SS#s on checks we were endorsing, etc. All the orders that were cut for years for just about anything had Rank and SS#s of everybody on them. Yup - - -! Wandering and Wondering
